Problem:
Consider a system described by a set of linear algebraic equations driven by a matrix function \\( X(t) = e^{At}X_0 \\), where A is a diagonalizable matrix. We further examine the effect of an integral transformation \\( g(X) = \\int_0^T e^{-At}X(t) dt \\) on the system.

If \\( X(T) \\) is observed and known to result from an evolution described by \\( X(t) = e^{At}X_0 \\), can we uniquely determine \\( X_0 \\) without knowing whether the transformation \\( g(X) \\) was applied at any point?
Explanation: Without explicit information about the application of the transformation \\( g(X) \\), it is not feasible to reverse-engineer the exact initial state \\( X_0 \\) because the integral transformation can significantly modify the trajectory that \\( X(t) \\) would follow from any guessed \\( X_0 \\).
